headline: Jacob Helberg, Trump's direct link to France's far right
subhead: Everyone in the French far right who wants to get close to Donald Trump knows that Jacob Helberg is the man to speak to. The French-American, a young under secretary of state for economic affairs, serves as a conduit for the reactionary, nationalist and anti-immigration vision that the president wants to impose on Europe.

headline: Epstein scandal prompts Jack Lang to offer resignation as head of the World Arab Institute
Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
The stigma that surrounds 'slut shaming' persists
subhead: Maïa Mazaurette, a columnist at Le Monde, reviews 'Slut Shaming,' the latest book from Ovidie. The writer traces the fallout from the 'porno chic' movement, an era when transgression ruled, while also warning against the 'sex-positive' feminism that followed.

headline: French companies cut down on drinking at work
subhead: Abstinence is gaining traction in France, including among employers. The electric utility company EDF banned alcohol consumption on all sites, prompting internal protest.

headline: Robert Crumb, comic book author: 'I am a paranoid person and I make fun of that'
subhead: In 'Tales of Paranoia,' the legend of American counterculture comics takes readers on a dizzying journey into the world of madness, illustrated with a case study: Robert Crumb.

headline: How climate change is transforming avalanches
subhead: As fatal accidents in the mountains continue, rising temperatures have generally led to less snow, resulting in avalanches that are, on average, less frequent and intense. However, snow slides above 2,000 meters are becoming more common.

headline: Washington Post CEO Will Lewis exits after drastic job cuts: 'Right time for me to step aside'

The Netherlands learns a lesson on right and far-right alliances
In Syria's Roj detention camp, jihadist women are convinced they will soon be 'freed'
subhead: The female prisoners, mostly foreign nationals who joined the Islamic State group in the 2010s, celebrate the advance of Syrian government forces, who are set to retake control of the camps and prisons in the Kurdish autonomous region under the January 30 agreement.
byline: Laurent Van der Stockt and  Madjid Zerrouky

headline: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
subhead: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

headline: Iranian photojournalist shares unseen images of Tehran protests
subhead: Images that capture the scale of the brutally suppressed protests that swept Iran between December 28 and January 11 are rare. Some NGOs report at least 18,000 people dead. Iranian photographer Yalda Moaiery managed to transmit her images of the January 8 demonstrations and the funeral of a man killed by the regime.

headline: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
'In the US, Christian nationalism contributes to the dismantling of democracy'
'Trump put liberal democracy in the crosshairs in 2025, he might pull the trigger in 2026'
